thread.section_title: The Historical Marker Database - New Entries
thread.title: Veterans Memorial

title: Veterans Memorial
text:
Washington in Washington County, Iowa — The American Midwest (Upper Plains)
Veterans Memorial
Men and Women
who serve our
country in
war and peace
Freedom is not free
All Gave Some
Some Gave All
Duty Honor Country
Erected 2015 by American Legion Post 29 and Federation Bank.
Topics. This memorial is listed in this topic list:
[Patriots & Patriotism](Results.asp?Search=Topic&CategoryID=43).
Location. 41° 17.889′ N, 91° 41.419′ W. Marker is in Washington, Iowa, in Washington County. Memorial is at the intersection of East Washington Street (State Highway 92) and South 2nd Avenue (State Highway 93), on the left when traveling west on East Washington Street. The marker is located near the southeast corner of the intersection, beside the Blair House.
[Touch for map](map.asp?markers=238396,238390,185713,176070,185712). Marker is at or near this postal address: 205 East Washington Street, Washington IA 52353, United States of America. Touch for directions.
Other nearby markers. At least 4 other markers are within 10 miles of this marker, measured as the crow flies.
[Blair House](m.asp?m=238390)(here, next to this marker); [First Settler's Home in Washington County](m.asp?m=185713)(approx. 9.8 miles away); [Beginning of National Republican Party](m.asp?m=176070) [The Old Military Road](m.asp?m=185712)(approx. 9.9 miles away).
Credits.
[This page was last] [revised](ChangeHistory.asp?m=238396)on December 31, 2023. It was originally submitted on December 30, 2023, by Cosmos Mariner of Cape Canaveral, Florida. This page has been viewed 27 times since then. Photos: 1, 2, 3. submitted on December 31, 2023, by Cosmos Mariner of Cape Canaveral, Florida.
